page.title: 20TWENTIETH CEN.ATHERSTONE
page.content: Despite the coming of the railway,the town continued as a semi-rural area, with little change occurring until the First World War.Yards remained crowded, but the situation was eased when slum clearance took place in 1930'& 1950's. Council houses were provided,followed by private.Even in 1938 there was some considerable concern that youngsters had to travel to local towns for employment This has been partly solved by the estabishment of a by-pass which encouraged a greater awareness in Ath. as part of a road transport network and consequently two industrial estates have been built(CARLYON RD & INNAGE PARK)dealing with a very wide range of factories eg metal,cardboard,textiles, chemical storage,container transport, sportsware,textiles,abrasives,footware.
